* A simple vector class with an x and a y component which default to 0
* All vector operations work functionally, creating a new vector instead of modifying the current one
// may not work properly if used on a non-unit vector
return new Vector(this.x / length, this.y / length);
return new Vector(v1.x * c, v1.y * c);
return new Vector(v1.x + v2.x, v1.y + v2.y);
return new Vector(v1.x - v2.x, v1.y - v2.y);
* A simple ray class. Has a point and a direction.
return new Point(this.pos.x + this.dir.x * t, this.pos.y + this.dir.y * t);
return new Point(this.pos.x + this.dir.x * t, this.pos.y + this.dir.y * t);
// Starts from the top left corner, and goes clockwise
// Edges will correspond to their left corner
* Takes two screen edges and returns the corners that aren't contained within two points that lie on those edges
* @return [Point] - An array of Points corresponding to the corners
* Takes two screen edges and returns the corners that are contained within two points that lie on those edges
* @return [Point] - An array of Points corresponding to the corners
* The input ray's position should be converted to screen space.
return Point.distBetween(ray.pos, intercepts[0][0]) < Point.distBetween(ray.pos, intercepts[1][0]) ? intercepts[0] : intercepts[1];
return point.x >= 0 && point.y >= 0 && point.x <= VIEWPORT_WIDTH && point.y <= VIEWPORT_HEIGHT;
